reviews.review_msg: He's an amazing lecturer. I feel like I learned so much from this course. There are quite a bit of writing assignments, but they are short ones and he's quite lenient with his marking. Attendance does matter. The midterm and final were straightforward. Take this course if you're interested.

Best prof I've had in all my years at SFU. He loves what he teaches and makes it interesting for students. Professor Newton is very approachable and kind. He doesn't make the course too demanding. Reading the textbook wasnt necessary, only thing on the MT from the book was one single MC question, but you'll need the course reader for assignments.

Super nice guy, I enjoyed attending his lectures, though they were 3 hours long. Assignments are frequent, but really easy, ie. response papers and map exercises. He does his best to keep the class engaged, shows movies + video clips and tell stories and cracks jokes in class.

Michael is very fair teacher. I found he provided a lot of insight and his personal stories helped to relate the material. The class was very interesting and gave me many new insights into Japanese culture and history. Final, 2 Midterms, paper, movie review, tut. presentation reqd effort but were useful.
A great prof. If you don't do well in his class it's your own fault.

Are you kidding me? This guy's quizzes were so easy; didn't have to study too much and he is very fair when marking your paper. Super friendly guy and is always willing to help -- doesn't reply to emails though so if you ahve a question, ask him after class
His quizzes were difficult, as were the presentation and the term paper. He has high expectations for a 200-level course. You really need to put in the time. Nice guy though.

Dr. Pendleton is a nice guy.  He helps his students every step of the way.  His quizzes are somewhat challenging (esp. the matching), but as long as you keep up with the reading and study his lecture notes, then you will do fine. Attendance is extremely important as his quizzes and tests are all based on what he says. Great class and professor!
Gosh, this class is just terrible. I don't recommend this class by THIS professor, especially if you're in your third or fourth year, it will just annoy you.

Oh my goodness i can't wait for this class to finish. As interesting as the topic is, this guy drives me nuts. Friendly, grampa-like professor with a bit of a stutter, but babies the class, has odd expectations and his bi-weekly exams matching questions are challenging. if you put the time in to study you should be fine...but it does require time
